1.title: Bienvenido a DAPNET Web!
1.text:
The DAPNET (Decentralized Amateur Paging Network) is a network operated by amateur radio enthusiasts. As it is used on amateur radio frequencies, commercial use is forbidden.
If you are a licensed amateur radio operator, get your login account now.

2.title: Transmisor Raspager
2.text: A low-cost and low-power personal transmitter as an add-on board for Raspberry Pi.

3.title: Coverage Map
3.text: Transmitters are displayed on a map with their simulated coverage area.

4.title: Touch Display for Transmitters
4.text: Easy-to-use graphical control display based on Nextion Displays. Connection to transmitter host via UART or USB2UART.

5.title: Unipager - One software for all transmitter types
5.text: Written in RUST, the Unipager software controls all transmitter types: Raspager, Ericsson C9000, Soundcard and RFM69. A Debian package is avaiable for easy install and update.

7.title: SDR based Transmitter with GM1200
7.text: All you need is a Raspberry Pi, a 9600 Baud-ready radio and a simple audio interface. Also feasable in combination with the touch display.

8.title: AlphaPOC 6002R paging reciever
8.text: Commercially avaiable, small and no modification needed. Easy on-pager programming.

9.title: Structure of DAPNET
9.text: Transparent and up-to-date comminication protocols like REST and Websocket are used.

10.title: Support by ticket system
10.text: Support requests are handled by a team for quick response time and maximum knowledge sharing.

information.map: Ir a la vista completa del mapa

actions.sendmailtoallowners: Envia un correo a todas los dueños

information.text:
This overview shows all registered transmitters of the DAPNET network. Before you can connect your transmitter to one of the DAPNET-Nodes, it has to be registered by one of the admins. There are two classes of transmitters: Widerange (> 1 Watt) and Personal (<= 1 Watt). Why is there such a big number of offline transmitters? These are transmitters which have been registered in the past, but apparently are not online now. There is no information stored which transmitters "should" be online and which not.
Transmitters have one or multiple owners who can change the settings by themselves. Each transmitter is assigned to one or max. 16 timeslots. This is necessary as they transmit all on the same frequency, but not overlapping at the same time. Be aware to assign no timeslots to your transmitter that are already used in you coverage area. Contact one of the admins, if you need help.

callsign.title: Señal de llamada
callsign.help: Enter a valid amateur radio callsign of this transmitter. It will be also used for the 10 minute interval transmitter identification message to fulfill the law (at least the German law).
callsign.helpedit: Changing this name will create a duplication and not change the element's name.

import.help: Easy import of stations from hamnetdb.net. Location data of the selected transmitter site will be copied into the form.

password.title: Contraseña
password.help: Enter a authentication password for this transmitter. In the UniPager webinterface it’s called Auth Key.

usage.title: Uso
usage.help: For classification of the transmitters, there are two categories: Personal (Transmitters with low output power like RasPager) and Wide Range (Higher output power and elevated location site).

antennatype.title: Tipo de antena
antennatype.help: Please select if you have a omnidirectional antenna (e.g. X-50) or a directional antenna (e.g. Yagi).

antennadirection.help: Dirección del haz principal de la antena: Enter the antenna main beam direction in degrees according to "True North" (in German "rechtweisend Nord").

power.help: Potencia del transmisor: Enter the transmitter output power in Watts including your cable losses.

antennalevel.help: Antena elevación sobre el suelo: Enter the antenna elevation over ground; NOT over NN (!) in meters.

antennagain.help: Ganancia de la antena: Enter the antenna gain in the main lobe direction for directional antennas and the average gain for omnidirectional antennas in dBi (dBi: Gain over isotropic radiator).

txidentric.help: Identificación del transmisor RIC: Enter a RIC (default value is 1) which will be used to generate an artificial paging message containing the amateur radio callsign as given in this form.

timeslots.title: Intervalo de Tiempo
timeslots.help: As all transmitters use the same frequency a time division multiplex access scheme is used. There are 16 timeslots available. Assign the slots of this transmitter according to you surrounding transmitters in your neighborhood without overlapping timeslots that are assigned to more than one transmitter. You can use the transmitter map to check already assigned timeslots of adjacent transmitters. In case that you cannot fulfill your requirements, contact the adjacent transmitter owners and try to get an agreement. Normally four 4 or less timeslots per transmitter are more than enough.

owner.help: Si usted es dueño, puede cambiar los parámetros de este transmisor.

table.description: This table shows the registered paging transmitters, their online status and additional information. Personal transmitters have low output power and a very small coverage. Wide range transmitters are usually installed at elevated locations leading to a wide coverage area.

checkbox.showbytimeslot: Mostrar transmisores por intervalo de tiempo
checkbox.shownodeline: Show linea desde el transmisor al nodo

load.title: Load coverage-overlays?
load.text: Press "Continue" to load all coverage-overlays for the currently visible transmitters. This may take some time and put your device under heavy load.

confirm.title: Are you really sure?
confirm.text: You are going to load and display the coverage of {amount} transmitters. This will take some time and put your device under heavy load.
confirm.continue: Yes, I am sure and I won't blame the developer if my browser crashes.

errors.title: Error
errors.api-unreachable: Unable to reach API server. Please try again later.
errors.permissions: Invalid login credentials or no permission for this request. Please check username and password.
errors.http-error: Unhandled HTTP error {status}. Please try again later.

404.title: Extraviado
404.text: No se puede encontrar el recurso solicitado.

delete.title: Estás seguro?
delete.text: No podrá recuperar estos datos una vez que se eliminend.

input.title: Registro faltante
input.text: Por favor complete cada campo para continuar.

information.help:
This is a list of all rubrics on the DAPNET. A rubric number can by assigned to several transmitter groups. Keep in mind that the transmitter groups are disjunct for the same rubric number in order to avoid overlapping number assigments.
Use the Activate Rubrics button to enable the reception of rubrics on your Skyper.

new.name: Nombre
new.namehelp: Cambiar este nombre creará una duplicación y <i> no </ i> cambiará el nombre del elemento.
new.label: Etiqueta

information.help: Rubrics are a Skyper based invention allowing to send news sorted into chategories (the rubrics). Assign the number with care and contact support [at] hampager.de in case of doubt. Be aware that the number of rubrics is limited netwide to 99.
Use the function to send an activation call to your Skyper. After successful reception, you can select the rubrics on "Skyper Setup" in the skyper menu.
A subscriber is the logical connection between a name (the callsign) and one or multiple RIC numbers, for example a Skyper address.

subscriber.title: Suscriptor
subscriber.help: Please enter a valid amateur radio callsign of a human or a classifying name of an organization.
subscriber.info: Cambiar este nombre creará una duplicación y <i> no </ i> cambiará el nombre del elemento.

description.help: Proporcione su nombre o cualquier otra descripción útil de este elemento.

pager.title: Buscapersonas
pager.helprics: Add one or more lines of pager RIC numbers.
pager.helpnames: Add a corresponding number for lines as a description for the RIC numbers given in the first box.

owner.title: Dueño
owner.help: Un dueño de una asociación de suscriptores puede editar sus parámetros

information.help: Subscribers are an allocation between a name (usually your amateur radio callsign) and one or multiple pager IDs (RICs).
Calls are personal paging transmission to individual receivers.

message.title: Mensaje
message.charactersremaining:
80 characters remaining.
Enter your paging text. Your user name is added automatically.

subscribers.help: Seleccione uno o varios suscriptores a qué enviar el mensaje.

transmittergroups.title: Groupos de transmisores
transmittergroups.help: Seleccione un grupo transmisor lógico que debe transmitir su mensaje. Por defecto son todos los transmisores, pero si conoce la ubicación aproximada del receptor, puede limitar los transmisores utilizados para su paginación a un área determinada. Esto reduce la carga en los transmisores.

emergency.title: Emergencia?
emergency.help: En caso de que desee que su mensaje se entregue lo antes posible, marque esta casilla. No ocurrirán cosas dañinas, DAPNET solo procesará su mensaje con la máxima prioridad. Por favor haz un uso justo de esta característica.

information.help: Aquí se muestran sus llamadas recientes.

The content displayed here are NOT general news about DAPNET, but the recently sent content to rubrics. Every time a user updates the 10 available rubric messages slots, this change will be displayed here.

These are the contents of rubrics. They are up to now only available on Skyper paging receivers in this form, but also sent as personal calls to RIC 1000 + (Rubric-Number) for reception with e.g. AlphaPoc.

overview.sendmailtoallowners: Send a mail to all owners

information.help: Los nodos son las instancias del clúster DAPNET. Esta lista muestra el estado de ellos.

name.title: Nombre
name.help: Cambiar este nombre creará una duplicación y <i> no </ i> cambiará el nombre del elemento.

information.help: Esta tabla muestra los nodos DAPNET Core registrados y es principalmente para información SysOp.

logout.seepagewrong: Si ves esta página, algo salió mal.
logout.emoji: Emoji proporcionado de forma gratuita por

error404.title: Error 404 - Not Found
error404.emoji: Emoji proporcionado de forma gratuita por

information.help: A transmitter group is a logical association of one or multiple transmitters to a group. This is necessary to divide the transmitters into regional areas, as not all content has to be transmitted on the whole network. Both personal calls as well als rubric's content have to be linked to a transmitter group. Only transmitters that are member of this group will get the information from the DAPNET node in order to transmit it.

new.namehelp: Changing this name will create a duplication and not change the element's name.

information.help: A transmitter group combines one of several transmitters to a logical entity.

overview.sendemailallusers: Enviar un correo a todos los usuarios

information.help: This is an overview of all registered user account on the DAPNET network. If you are not an admin, you don't see other user's details. You can edit your user by yourself, e.g. change your passwort or your email address.

new.namehelp: Cambiar este nombre creará una duplicación y <i> no </ i> cambiará el nombre del elemento.

password.help: Eso es la una nueva contraseña aleatoria:

information.help: Esta tabla muestra los usuarios registrados y su información detallada.
